content.description:
The start of this route is a strenuous, right trending slabby boulder problem. In your face straight off the ground. When I climbed the route I found two bail biners, likely due to people confusing it with its neighbor to the (climbers) right, Climbing on the Brain. Fight your way up 12 (or so) bolts to a chain anchor. Really fun route.

This route is not in Grahm Doe's Shuteye Ridge guidebook.
content.location: If coming down from the Alcove skirt around the small slab waterfall and up a climbers trail to the base. It is to the left of Climbing on the Brain 11a, and to the right of Hot Black Dike 10a.

content.description: This is a good warm-up route for the area, since the climbing is mostly continuous 5.10 until the crux roof finale.  This is a beautiful long route with interesting movement. Do it!
content.location: The rightmost of the 3 long routes...

content.description:
This long climb starts out with a tricky move down low with continuous technical face climbing through a roof mid way.  The finish is a incredible Gunks style roof with huge holds.

Rap with two ropes or use the mid anchors on the 5.12.
